revised_title: The Structure and Action of the Crystalline Lens in Fishes and Quadrupeds
tldr: David Brewster examines the structure of the crystalline lens in fish and quadrupeds using polarized light. He discovers that the lens has a complex structure with a central nucleus, an outer spherical shell, and an intermediate shell in a state of contraction. This structure is essential for correcting spherical aberration and has different optical properties in different directions.
